summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 discussing the status of a 'taint review' of materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. Prosecutors and law enforcement are coordinating with Epstein's defense attorneys regarding search terms and access to the seized evidence.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of the case; materials were seized from his Manhattan residence and are undergoing taint review.

events.title: Materials made available from Epstein residence
events.description: Materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence were made available for review.

events.title: Taint review search terms completed
events.description: Prosecutors ran search terms provided by Epstein's attorney and segregated the hits, with few results found.

keyFacts: A taint review was being conducted on materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence.
The materials were made available on September 10, 2019.
Epstein's defense attorney provided search terms for the taint review, which were run by prosecutors with few hits.
Law enforcement supervisors were requesting status updates on the taint review process for a meeting with the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge).
The email chain shows coordination between prosecutors and Epstein's defense team regarding evidence review procedures.
